page.title: 06LOCAL HISTORY,SAUNDERSFOOT.
page.content: School was on The Ridgeway,the same building as we use today.The school- master had a high desk in the middle of the hall and often gave the boys the stick. Girls wore high-button boots,boys clogs with horseshoes or hobnailed boots which made sparks on the stones. All the clothes and shoes were made in the village. Mr Howells went on to Greenhill Grammar School,Tenby,walking 4 miles each way.He later became an apprentice pharmacist and subsequently {Founder {President of the Commonwealth {Pharmaceutical Association. Mary Griffiths left the village only twice a year,travelling by hired horse and cart to the station,then by train to Tenby.(One occasion being for the taking of the annual family photograph).
